summary: The document is a letter from J. G. Robert Blakey to Scott Breckinridge of the CIA, dated July 19, 1978, requesting assistance in arranging interviews with individuals in Mexico. It references a prior conversation between Chairman Stokes and Admiral Turner and notes the potential sensitivity or classified nature of the information involved, suggesting the document itself may require classification.
key_findings: The letter is associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It indicates ongoing investigations or inquiries related to the JFK assassination by seeking CIA assistance for interviews in Mexico.
The mention of sensitive or classified information underscores the confidential nature of the investigations surrounding the JFK assassination.
